[{'created': '2020-04-03 05:33:25.000000000', 'message': 'Add new default roles in server group policies

This adds new defaults roles in server group API policies.
- pause/unpause policies are default to system admin or project member.

Also add tests to simulates the future where we drop the deprecation
fall back in the policy by overriding the rules with a version where
there are no deprecated rule options. Operators can do the same by
adding overrides in their policy files that match the default but
stop the rule deprecation fallback from happening.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

Change-Id: Ia5d085c76560a5a75f5dfe9a7b630877cac8a478

'}, {'created': '2020-04-14 14:52:25.000000000', 'message': 'Add new default roles in server group policies

This adds new defaults roles in server group API policies.
- PROJECT_MEMBER_OR_SYSTEM_ADMIN, for delete sg
- PROJECT_READER_OR_SYSTEM_READER for GET sg
- PROJECT_MEMBER for create server group

Reason for PROJECT_MEMBER which is forst time introduced in policy:
POST SG need project_id to create the serve groups (same for POST
server). system scope members does not have project id which mean they are
not project itself.

If we allow system scope role also then created SG will have project_id
of system role not the one he/she want to create the SG for (nobody can
create the SG for other projects because API does not take project id in
request ). So keeping this scoped to project as these role
are the only one who will create SG.

This commit introducing the PROJECT_MEMBER in policy so
adding the old rule in deprecated list of PROJECT_MEMBER
so that old token can still keep working. This can be
verified in tests.

Also add tests to simulates the future where we drop the deprecation
fall back in the policy by overriding the rules with a version where
there are no deprecated rule options. Operators can do the same by
adding overrides in their policy files that match the default but
stop the rule deprecation fallback from happening.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

Change-Id: Ia5d085c76560a5a75f5dfe9a7b630877cac8a478

This commit introducing the PROJECT_MEMBER in policy so
adding the old rule in deprecated list of PROJECT_MEMBER
so that old token can still keep working. This can be
verified in tests.

Also add tests to simulates the future where we drop the deprecation

Change-Id: Ia5d085c76560a5a75f5dfe9a7b630877cac8a478

commit_message:
Add new default roles in server group policies

This adds new defaults roles in server group API policies.
- PROJECT_MEMBER_OR_SYSTEM_ADMIN, for delete sg
- PROJECT_READER_OR_SYSTEM_READER for GET sg
- PROJECT_MEMBER for create server group

Reason for PROJECT_MEMBER which is forst time introduced in policy:
POST SG need project_id to create the serve groups (same for POST
server). system scope members does not have project id which mean they are
not project itself.

If we allow system scope role also then created SG will have project_id
of system role not the one he/she want to create the SG for (nobody can
create the SG for other projects because API does not take project id in
request ). So keeping this scoped to project as these role
are the only one who will create SG.

This commit introducing the PROJECT_MEMBER in policy so
adding the old rule in deprecated list of PROJECT_MEMBER
so that old token can still keep working. This can be
verified in tests.

Also add tests to simulates the future where we drop the deprecation
fall back in the policy by overriding the rules with a version where
there are no deprecated rule options. Operators can do the same by
adding overrides in their policy files that match the default but
stop the rule deprecation fallback from happening.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

Change-Id: Ia5d085c76560a5a75f5dfe9a7b630877cac8a478

"}, {'created': '2020-04-14 13:17:13.000000000', 'message': "Cleanup py27 support

This repo is now testing only with Python
3, so let's make
a few cleanups:
- Remove python 2.7 stanza from setup.py
- Remove obsolete sections from setup.cfg

commit_message:
Cleanup py27 support

This repo is now testing only with Python
3, so let's make
a few cleanups:
- Remove python 2.7 stanza from setup.py
- Remove obsolete sections from setup.cfg
- Cleanup doc/source/conf.py to remove noww
 obsolete content.

Change-Id: I6f85271e1750d6fa9006847feb18a1390f9048ea

commit_message:
Add new default roles in quota sets policies

This adds new defaults roles in quota sets API policies.
- SYSTEM_ADMIN for update and delete quota.
- PROJECT_READER_OR_SYSTEM_READER for GET quota.

Also add tests to simulates the future where we drop the deprecation
fall back in the policy by overriding the rules with a version where
there are no deprecated rule options. Operators can do the same by
adding overrides in their policy files that match the default but
stop the rule deprecation fallback from happening.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

Change-Id: I3c9f60e678fd0d416d02bf3716b31ade1883bb1e

commit_message:
Pass the actual target in flavor extra specs policy

Currently if target is not passed in context.can(),
it use defauls target which is context.user_id, context.project_id.
These defaults target are not useful as it pass the
context's user_id and project_id only which means we tell
oslo policy to verify the context data with context data.

This commit pass the actual target for flavor extra specs policies
which is empty dict for policy with system scoped and context project_id
for GET which are system and project scoped.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

Change-Id: If488d0d6906a87980fc795b9a5fa2604089a5e1e

commit_message:
Use placement stable version for functional job

nova-tox-functional is py2 job and need placement as required project.
and started failing for incompatible py version:

ERROR: Package 'openstack-placement' requires a different Python: 2.7.17 not in '>=3.6'

- https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/b460a8c59ad64e57b871aa3c00638b01/log/job-output.txt#782

Placement master is now py3 only which mean master version will stop
working on py2 env:
- I6f458fb60b5a33b5aa2ce3ab292862ab98eb4670

Current tox env mention the placement master link as deps, where need to use
the stable version for stable jobs. Making deps with version not the
fresh git clone like how other test-requirements.txt deps work.

Conflict File:
    tox.ini due to deps used for functional tox env
Change-Id: I96bb9fcb55f2a4fc3aefa01db70b45740db166c8

commit_message:
OVN: Add note re IGMP groups upon ovn-controller service restart

This patch is adding an important note to the IGMP configuration guide
regarding to what happens to the IGMP groups upon the restart of the
ovn-controller service.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I02a78a557158fa58091f20514c52c27eecf2616d
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>

messages: [{'account_id': 27032, 'date': '2020-04-14 10:42:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 27032, 'date': '2020-04-14 10:43:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 23567, 'date': '2020-04-15 08:04:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 11600, 'date': '2020-04-15 08:17:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-14 10:42:57.000000000', 'message': 'Ensure SG rule is deleted from CRD upon Namespace deletion

When a namespace is deleted/updated the corresponding sg rule is
deleted on Neutron but the pointer on the CRD still remains,
which breaks the patching during a network policy update, as the
first sg rule will have an ID and the second one no.

This commit ensures the sg rule is also removed from the CRD.

Change-Id: I2193f0900b49398b091c5a8f9ba16709e73b1b35
'}, {'created': '2020-04-14 10:43:56.000000000', 'message': 'Ensure SG rule is deleted from CRD upon Namespace deletion

When a namespace is deleted/updated the corresponding sg rule is
deleted on Neutron but the pointer on the CRD still remains,
which might break the CRD patching during a network policy update.

This commit ensures the sg rule is also removed from the CRD.

Closes-bug: 1872688
Change-Id: I2193f0900b49398b091c5a8f9ba16709e73b1b35
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure SG rule is deleted from CRD upon Namespace deletion

When a namespace is deleted/updated the corresponding sg rule is
deleted on Neutron but the pointer on the CRD still remains,
which might break the CRD patching during a network policy update.

This commit ensures the sg rule is also removed from the CRD.

Closes-bug: 1872688
Change-Id: I2193f0900b49398b091c5a8f9ba16709e73b1b35

This policy is default to SYSTEM_ADMIN for create, update and

there are no deprecated rule options. Operators can do the same by
adding overrides in their policy files that match the default but
stop the rule deprecation fallback from happening.

commit_message:
Add new default roles in flavor extra specs policies

This adds new defaults roles in flavor extra specs API policies.
This policy is default to SYSTEM_ADMIN for create, update and
delete specs and PROJECT_READER_OR_SYSTEM_READER for
get specs.

Also add tests to simulates the future where we drop the deprecation
fall back in the policy by overriding the rules with a version where
there are no deprecated rule options. Operators can do the same by
adding overrides in their policy files that match the default but
stop the rule deprecation fallback from happening.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

Change-Id: Ic6332e47ab587b8ac37de1ada62f2ff41e5a1762

commit_message:
Update hacking for Python3

The repo is Python 3 now, so update hacking to version 3.0 which
supports Python 3.

Fix problems found by updated hacking version.

The tempest plugin is used on older branches as well.
We really only need hacking on master anyways,
where we no longer support python 2, so here we
make the requirement specific to python 3.

Change-Id: I885da1613e9cf754302700019a1207a279b3af2a

Fine to move ahead, but I would like to see these addressed, and the list of excluded tests reduce, going forward.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-04-08 16:46:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 16668, 'date': '2020-04-08 21:19:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

commit_message:
Mark Nimble Storage Driver supported

Nimble Storage cinder driver had been marked as unsupported due to lack
of external CI running log. CI system is up
and running, updating it to be supported

Change-Id: I9c22c5f224a510e125b1dd82441eb1d63a8728f3
Signed-off-by: Raunak Kumar <rkumar@nimblestorage.com>

commit_message:
Release Heat 13.0.1

This change [1] is not released but is critical in
order to make Iginition work without issues when
using for example Magnum with Fedora CoreOS.

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/heat/commit/e11cfb569bf7037f07466059f9404eb1949bbfde

Change-Id: I6f315fd414cf6de882bb582b0da4dae5c1eddeb5

commit_message:
Adding description for testcases - compute part1

When Tempest is used in customer site, often we are required to
provide a testcase list including testcase names and descriptions.
Now no this kind of doc is available, however, we can extract info
from tempest code to create one, but, some testcases don't have
descriptions about what the testcases are testing, so, we can add
descrption for each testcase.

There are hundreds of testcases missing descriptions, so we can
add them gradually, and limit the modified files in one patch
for the convenience of reviewing.

Change-Id: Id90d6fedccc84aa9548fba62b5926a75050ab443
partially-implements: blueprint testcase-description

BUILD_TIMEOUT is not needed anymore

The option BUILD_TIMEOUT has been deprecated in Pike and renamed to
IRONIC_TEMPEST_BUILD_TIMEOUT

BUILD_TIMEOUT is not needed anymore

The option BUILD_TIMEOUT has been deprecated in Pike and renamed to
IRONIC_TEMPEST_BUILD_TIMEOUT

Change-Id: I98b047368444d819ea8c9d48fec9e7d05f95bf8b

subject: DONOTMERGE : Simplified functional test job
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-09 01:12:00.000000000', 'message': 'DONOTMERGE : Simplified functional test job

This funcitoal job will setup a single node and install
the core services along with the dependent services required
by tacker service.

This job will not run functional tests which requires
multiple-node setup.

Change-Id: I9c5d0f57530fd75f1f7edf84cdbf8a1666eeb6bd
'}]
commit_message:
DONOTMERGE : Simplified functional test job

This funcitoal job will setup a single node and install
the core services along with the dependent services required
by tacker service.

This job will not run functional tests which requires
multiple-node setup.

Change-Id: I9c5d0f57530fd75f1f7edf84cdbf8a1666eeb6bd

commit_message:
Bump role versions and retire roles

Master tempest do not support py2.7 and 3.5 which is still the case
for train release.
Also as we are running tests for train, we should use train version of
roles as well.

This patch also retires pip_install and repo_build roles.

Change-Id: I44152be917af3c7ff962425bd11a70fd804bef81

commit_message:
Cleanup py27 support

Make a few cleanups:
- Remove python 2.7 stanza from setup.py
- Add requires on python >= 3.6 to setup.cfg so that pypi and pip
  know about the requirement
- Remove obsolete sections from setup.cfg
- Update classifiers
- Switch to using sphinx-build, fix doc problems

Change-Id: I2db738820744e1931949e4618299cdb2e7832d2a

commit_message:
[Q->T] Introduce Queens to Train Upgrade

We introduce Stein images to allow jumping the databases from
Q to S and than to T. This allows us only to do necessary DB sync
for Stein and Train.

Co-Authored-By: jfrancoa@redhat.com, sgolovat@redhat.com, gfidente@redhat.com, jpretori@redhat.com
Change-Id: I676245ba7c1593343955af5c5698c1a9bb08b7ac

commit_message:
Fix multistack inventory

Switch to new multistack inventory class interface.
Also TRIPLEO_PLAN_NAME did not work for comma seperated list.

Depends-On: Ife14dbe04dd11db44a944f98373f63e01dfbb8d8
Change-Id: I2cc721676005536b14995980f7a042991c92adcc
Related-bug: #1849073
(cherry picked from commit afe97a302451c26f7f187e31357b6743986229f6)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-09 10:05:38.000000000', 'message': "tripleo-validations failing on lower constraints

python-openstackclient requires:
- keystoneauth1>=3.14.0
- openstacksdk>=0.36.0

but openstacksdk requires:
- os-service-types>=1.7.0
- keystoneauth1>=3.16.0

(cherry picked from commit 1fcd82564a9b2e0aadc57069899ce083f92718ab)

Drop eventlet from lower constraints

oslo.service has bumped the min requirement to 0.22.0 with
commit 19517d0bd6b34a54ae2779aff98af5172c09e4b6.

It's not directly used in tripleo-validations and there is
no reason to constrain it.

(cherry picked from commit 2ff7cbcae14942a4e52854544108e3b6494500d5)

Change-Id: Iebe2cc4181110c5563f13540b35e59b17037abea
"}, {'created': '2020-04-09 12:31:14.000000000', 'message': 'tripleo-validations failing on lower constraints

Bump tripleo-common to 11.3.1 to remove mistral requirement.

Change-Id: Iebe2cc4181110c5563f13540b35e59b17037abea
'}, {'created': '2020-04-09 13:16:19.000000000', 'message': 'tripleo-validations failing on lower constraints

Bump tripleo-common to 11.3.2 to remove mistral requirement.
Adds metalsmith requirement which requires:
  openstacksdk>=0.29.0 which requires:
    keystoneauth1>=3.13.0

Change-Id: Iebe2cc4181110c5563f13540b35e59b17037abea
'}, {'created': '2020-04-09 14:22:36.000000000', 'message': 'tripleo-validations failing on lower constraints

Bump tripleo-common to 11.3.2 to remove mistral requirement.
Adds metalsmith requirement which requires:
  openstacksdk>=0.29.0 which requires:
    keystoneauth1>=3.13.0

Change-Id: Iebe2cc4181110c5563f13540b35e59b17037abea
'}]
commit_message:
tripleo-validations failing on lower constraints

Bump tripleo-common to 11.3.2 to remove mistral requirement.
Adds metalsmith requirement which requires:
  openstacksdk>=0.29.0 which requires:
    keystoneauth1>=3.13.0

Change-Id: Iebe2cc4181110c5563f13540b35e59b17037abea

commit_message:
PowerMax Driver - Replication Metadata Fix

When retyping from replicated to non-replicated a volume
retains the replicated metadata.

When concurrently creating and deleting replication
enabled volumes metadata can mismatch after recent
SRDF changes. Moving co-ordination lock resolves.

Change-Id: Iff3a28958d9594059e991206d3e23d3490cb74cc

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-03 14:55:21.000000000', 'message': '[DVR] Don't populate unbound ports in router's ARP cache

When user is using keepalived on their instances, he often creates
additional port in Neutron to allocate some IP address which will
be then used as VIP in keepalived and will be configured in
allowed_address_pair of other ports plugged to instances with
keepalived.
This is e.g. Octavia's use case.

This together with DVR caused problems with connectivity to such VIP
as it was populated in router's arp cache with MAC address from
Neutron db.

As this port isn't bound, it is only Neutron db entry so there is no
need to set it in arp cache of the router.
This patch is doing exactly that to filter such "unbound" and
"binding_failed" ports from the list.

Change-Id: Ia885ce00dbb5f2968859e8d0850bc511016f0846
Closes-Bug: #1869887
(cherry picked from commit eb775458c6da57426703289c7b969caddb83d677)
'}]
commit_message:
[DVR] Don't populate unbound ports in router's ARP cache

When user is using keepalived on their instances, he often creates
additional port in Neutron to allocate some IP address which will
be then used as VIP in keepalived and will be configured in
allowed_address_pair of other ports plugged to instances with
keepalived.
This is e.g. Octavia's use case.

This together with DVR caused problems with connectivity to such VIP
as it was populated in router's arp cache with MAC address from
Neutron db.

As this port isn't bound, it is only Neutron db entry so there is no
need to set it in arp cache of the router.
This patch is doing exactly that to filter such "unbound" and
"binding_failed" ports from the list.

Change-Id: Ia885ce00dbb5f2968859e8d0850bc511016f0846
Closes-Bug: #1869887
(cherry picked from commit eb775458c6da57426703289c7b969caddb83d677)

commit_message:
Explicitly handle baremetal ports when checking if they are active

Currently we rely on [service_available]ironic which
1) will give incorrect results in a mixed environment
2) doesn't work in grenade jobs

This change only allows ports to be DOWN when they have VNIC type
of baremetal.

Change-Id: If24913b7097c5252a214bb780fc786aa0c3f983b

commit_message:
Update hacking for Python3

The repo is Python 3 now, so update hacking to version 3.0 which
supports Python 3.

Update local hacking checks for new flake8.

Fix problems found.

Remove hacking and friends from lower-constraints, they are not needed
to be installed at run-time.

Add Pygments to lower-constraints to pass requirements-check.

Change-Id: I6c4ee81afbd43d4a29b5049bfc8cdaf779f13b8c

messages:
[{'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2020-04-10 16:24:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2020-04-10 16:29:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

This job needs to run in project-config and not in a branched repo, so should we enforce it with making it protected/final?'}, {'account_id': 1, 'date': '2020-04-10 16:53:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I'm not sure that protected or final would prevent someone from just adding this job to a pipeline in-repo.  They would prevent someone inheriting it and passing other parameters, and while that's harmless, it's also confusing, so it's probably good to set them."}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2020-04-10 16:57:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2020-04-10 17:01:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2020-04-10 19:28:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

So just to be clear, we're not going with the regular expression match on the project name(space) suggested in the ML thread?"}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2020-04-10 19:30:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

> So just to be clear, we're not going with the regular expression
 > match on the project name(space) suggested in the ML thread?

Let's ask Jim about what needs adding where here.."}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2020-04-10 19:36:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Well, I mean, this ought to also be safe for now, it just requires a 1:1 match between OpenDev namespaces and GitHub organization names, which may not be sufficiently flexible for other projects (but will work for OpenStack so is probably a fine place to start).'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2020-04-14 09:48:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

I think that should work, but Jim should review it before we enable it :)'}, {'account_id': 1, 'date': '2020-04-14 21:38:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

I think this is secure.  It won't let someone push content to the wrong project.  The only downside of not having the regex-based check is that if someone adds this job to x/foo and the github user corresponding to this ssh key doesn't have permissions, that may register as an error on the github side, and if it happens a lot, they may notice and take action.  I doubt that anyone will add this job where it shouldn't be, and if they did, i doubt the additional noise would be enough for github to notice, so overall, I deem it a very low risk."}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2020-04-15 05:22:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Revert "Revert "Introduce job for granular GitHub mirroring""

This change inroduces the usage of the parent job which enforces
a project name inside of it to avoid a project from mirroring
maliciously to another one.

It reparents it to the nodeless job inside opendev, enforeces the
setting of target_repository inside the secret so it cannot be modified
and fixes the `user` to point to `git` instead.

This reverts commit 04133b4bccb931b403a22ddcd49737e02907dd2a.

Change-Id: Iac5db122eb41709dffcdae675137723cd49fca8f

commit_message:
Fix invalid assert statement

This is to fix the following assert statements:
* asser_called_once_with, which should be assert_called_once_with
* asser_called_once, which should be assert_called_once

commit_message:
AFS Grafana : add mirror release timers

Add mirror release timing stats added by
I3d79d1a0997af8977050b7f6e7cf3b7578cc8491

Separate out from the project release timers, as they are very
different and thus swamp the faster results.

Add the docs/docs.dev to the release overview too.

Change-Id: I349bbe08b171090d10326c6dfe64a8d8368f08a8

commit_message:
Use threads insted of greethreads in IP monitor

IP monitor is a method that is going to be executed in a separate
process, to monitor the IP addresses changes in a namespace.

This method spawns a thread to read from a socket opened by Pyroute2.
The read function is a blocking method that will end only when the
socket is closed. To avoid thread starvation that can happen using
greenthreads, IP monitor will use kernel threads.

This will increase the resources used but will ensure that no message
is lost when reading the monitor socket.

Reduced the number of IPs generated in "test_add_and_remove_multiple_ips"
to shrink the testing time used.

Change-Id: I3fbba2854d40ab0f683443aa30c2a95752345d2e
Closes-Bug: #1849547
(cherry picked from commit 48730d9449c0e425637f0f1182d81f60a3d259ac)

commit_message:
Introduce scope_types in quota set Policies

oslo.policy introduced the scope_type feature which can
control the access level at system-level and project-level.
 - https://docs.openstack.org/oslo.policy/latest/user/usage.html#setting-scope
 - http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/keystone-specs/specs/keystone/queens/system-scope.html

Appropriate scope_type for nova case:
- https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/ussuri/approved/policy-defaults-refresh.html#scope

This commit introduce scope_type for Quota set API policies
as 'system' for update and delete quotas and ['system', 'project']
for get, default quotas.

Also adds the test case with scope_type enabled and verify we
pass and fail the policy check with expected context.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

Change-Id: I07d699e3ed7ccd5b8c55a15b7f8092b02fb5bda0

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-07 20:18:31.000000000', 'message': 'Increase waiting time for network rescheduling

Increate waiting time in "test_reschedule_network_on_new_agent", when
the network is being rescheduled from a dead DHCP agent to an running
one.

According to [1], 120 seconds could be a convervative and enough value
to wait for this transition.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1799555/comments/23

commit_message:
Increase waiting time for network rescheduling

Increate waiting time in "test_reschedule_network_on_new_agent", when
the network is being rescheduled from a dead DHCP agent to an running
one.

According to [1], 120 seconds could be a convervative and enough value
to wait for this transition.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1799555/comments/23

Change-Id: I2fec6015b56fd1b5d21b75f7432c40b2110fe6bc
Related-Bug: #1799555
(cherry picked from commit d15ad2e481b9b888079d55ba46d73ca5b7253285)

Please a a release note.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2020-03-03 17:42:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

I don't understand the need for this. Only keystone really has a separate admin endpoint, and that was phased out with the v2 API. As far as I'm aware, the recommended practice is to use the same endpoints for internal and admin."}, {'account_id': 167, 'date': '2020-03-03 17:52:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Was there not even an official document somewhere that deprecated the admin or the internal endpoint? I remember some e-mail or something. But I can't find it right now. It's been a while."}, {'account_id': 29344, 'date': '2020-03-04 05:35:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

> I don't understand the need for this. Only keystone really has a

 > endpoints for internal and admin.

some times some customer need separate admin vip and admin fqdn.Use thre plane  endpoints.So i think this patch  have a little useful?"}, {'account_id': 29344, 'date': '2020-03-04 05:37:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

> I don't understand the need for this. Only keystone really has a
 > separate admin endpoint, and that was phased out with the v2 API.

In this patch, the default admin endpoint same as internal endpoint."}, {'account_id': 167, 'date': '2020-03-04 10:01:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

utility installed onto the conductor to manipulate partition
information. The responsible package is now installed

This policy is default to:

adding overrides in their policy files that match the default but
stop the rule deprecation fallback from happening.

commit_message:
Add new default roles in tenant tenant usage policies

This adds new defaults roles in tenant tenant usage API policies.
This policy is default to:
- PROJECT_MEMBER_OR_SYSTEM_ADMIN for tenant usage statistics for
a specific tenant
- SYSTEM_ADMIN for list tenant usage statistics.

Also add tests to simulates the future where we drop the deprecation
fall back in the policy by overriding the rules with a version where
there are no deprecated rule options. Operators can do the same by
adding overrides in their policy files that match the default but
stop the rule deprecation fallback from happening.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

Change-Id: I6756859fd68e71f829dfcf5bf7bcb8b7c2cdb75a

commit_message:
Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/ussuri

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/ussuri branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I68796d9dd36f356c24877c5199192e2b942dd5f2

subject: Move suse builds to nb04, drop pip-and-virtualenv
messages:
[{'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2020-04-08 02:39:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6593, 'date': '2020-04-08 06:18:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

The pip-and-virtualenv element is working with master version of diskimage-builder.

When we just remove the element without replacement, how do we pull in python/python3 otherwise? It would be missing then I think'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2020-04-13 22:22:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> The pip-and-virtualenv element is working with master version of diskimage-builder.

"working" in the same way it works on fedora, which is leaving behind links to things that don't exist etc. due to no python2

> When we just remove the element without replacement, how do we pull in python/python3 otherwise? It would be missing then I think

We have roles that use venv to install on the hosts, and brings in Python 3 if nothing else did.'}, {'account_id': 6593, 'date': '2020-04-14 12:00:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

well, there is python2 (itself) available, just nothing else anymore. so I think those links are *not* stale on opensuse right now.'}, {'account_id': 4146, 'date': '2020-04-14 19:50:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2020-04-14 19:50:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I'm fine with moving forward here.

Do we have non-devstack tests that will break?

Ian, what about zuul-jobs?"}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2020-04-15 01:31:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Workflow+1

I understand there's two things at play here -- there's tumbleweed which doesn't have python3, and some sort of uninstallation error on 15 due to distutils packaging.

I don't think we gain anything by releasing a dib with a pip-and-virtualenv element we want to get rid of in a state where it's installing python3 packages thinking they're python2 packages.

I say we go with this, work on the zuul-roles for pip, which are all ready with at least one +2, post haste and work from there.

I will monitor the builds of this so we have the images, and the zuul-roles can then validate things and follow shortly."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-08 02:39:59.000000000', 'message': "Move suse builds to nb04, drop pip-and-virtualenv

Move these images to nb04, the container-based builder.  Pause them on
the other builders.  Due to upstream changes the pip-and-virtualenv
element doesn't work on them any more; remove it.  Work is in progress
to fix our base jobs to operate on platforms such as this, but in the
mean time devstack tests should work.

Change-Id: I0b5ccf6f0b441bdb752b5f066b69edda92f4b37a
"}]
commit_message:
Move suse builds to nb04, drop pip-and-virtualenv

Move these images to nb04, the container-based builder.  Pause them on
the other builders.  Due to upstream changes the pip-and-virtualenv
element doesn't work on them any more; remove it.  Work is in progress
to fix our base jobs to operate on platforms such as this, but in the
mean time devstack tests should work.

Change-Id: I0b5ccf6f0b441bdb752b5f066b69edda92f4b37a

commit_message:
Use SBusClient for execute command

This patch is the final refactoring work to have client library
for sbus communication, and port current implementaion about
execute command from runtime to SBusClient.

This patch makes execute command rely on the same communication
as the other commands, which happens on SERVICE_OUT_FD, and remove
TASK_ID_OUT_FD which is used only for returning task id.
This allows us to avoid special handling for execute command.

Change-Id: I00dc7b3004512624f9aaf120420f910e451cac89

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-05 19:40:42.000000000', 'message': 'Add trunk subports to be one of dvr serviced device owners

When "trunk:subport" wasn't added to the list of device owners which
are supported by dvr, there was no proper config in br-int's openflow
rules for such port, e.g. there was no dvr_to_src_mac rule in table 1
added and traffic from such port was never going through br-int.

Trunk ports should be added to this dvr serviced device owners list and
that patch is adding it there.

Conflicts:
    neutron/common/utils.py

Change-Id: Ic21089adfa32dbf5d0e29a89713e6e2bf28f0f05
Closes-Bug: #1870114
(cherry picked from commit d0a16522272bce64bceca1ccdb8d98a38d953cf5)
'}]
commit_message:
Add trunk subports to be one of dvr serviced device owners

When "trunk:subport" wasn't added to the list of device owners which
are supported by dvr, there was no proper config in br-int's openflow
rules for such port, e.g. there was no dvr_to_src_mac rule in table 1
added and traffic from such port was never going through br-int.

Trunk ports should be added to this dvr serviced device owners list and
that patch is adding it there.

Conflicts:
    neutron/common/utils.py

Change-Id: Ic21089adfa32dbf5d0e29a89713e6e2bf28f0f05
Closes-Bug: #1870114
(cherry picked from commit d0a16522272bce64bceca1ccdb8d98a38d953cf5)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-14 15:36:12.000000000', 'message': "tripleo_bootstrap: do not fail if OVS rpm wasn't found

We have a use case where OVS rpm can be missing on very basic images,l
ike overcloud-minimal. This image can be used by downstream for e.g.
Ceph Storage nodes, where an OSP subscription wasn't used (OVS needs
OSP).

It was reported here: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1820306

This patch will look at eventual failures of the bootstrap packages
task, and stop the deployment only if OVS failed to be found, otherwise
the deployment will move on.

Change-Id: Ib8dcc48c15b04b810b1cde350d5138671469977e
(cherry picked from commit 17e413947697cc56356e1fbab3914587414131e8)
"}]
commit_message:
tripleo_bootstrap: do not fail if OVS rpm wasn't found

We have a use case where OVS rpm can be missing on very basic images,l
ike overcloud-minimal. This image can be used by downstream for e.g.
Ceph Storage nodes, where an OSP subscription wasn't used (OVS needs
OSP).

It was reported here: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1820306

This patch will look at eventual failures of the bootstrap packages
task, and stop the deployment only if OVS failed to be found, otherwise
the deployment will move on.

Change-Id: Ib8dcc48c15b04b810b1cde350d5138671469977e
(cherry picked from commit 17e413947697cc56356e1fbab3914587414131e8)

[{'created': '2020-04-03 06:54:33.000000000', 'message': 'Add ssh timeout for baremetal_deploy

commit_message:
Add ssh timeout for baremetal_deploy

Mistakingly and historically
tripleo.baremetal_deploy.v1.deploy_instances used to pass its
timeout input into ansible connection timeout instead of
global/deployment timeout.

To pertain the established tradition for setting connection timeout to
some timeout, add missing input for ansible connection timeout and give
it some reasonable value.

The use of the timeout input to be passed into the real deployment
timeout parameter is fixed in the scope of the related bug.

Related-Bug: #1868063

Change-Id: I7d2fce9f07c98b1770c01cacbae2d17b8e143b3b
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 3d3afa62dc392236dd3191956ed2bf2f05f3b0e1)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-06 02:04:24.000000000', 'message': "Prevent share type deletion if linked to group types

Share types can be associated with share group
types. This relationship needs to be dropped in
case share types are to be deleted, or we'll be
leaving behind dead references in the database.
Share groups cannot exist without share group
types, and hence we don't need to check on existing
groups when deleting share types; checking for
existing group types will suffice.

While deleting share group types, the projects
provided access to private share group types weren't
being cleaned up.

Change-Id: Id135a96f2d1b7306156bab0ddedcb1b838a74f0a
Closes-Bug: #1699836
Partial-Bug: #1870751
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>
"}, {'created': '2020-04-06 15:56:09.000000000', 'message': "Delete type access list when deleting types

Currently we're in a foobar situation with two database
models ShareTypeProjects and ShareGroupTypeProjects
where we keep stuff around even when the concerned
ShareType or ShareGroupType objects are deleted.

So, delete type access rules when types are being deleted.

Change-Id: Id135a96f2d1b7306156bab0ddedcb1b838a74f0a
Closes-Bug: #1870751
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Delete type access list when deleting types

Currently we're in a foobar situation with two database
models ShareTypeProjects and ShareGroupTypeProjects
where we keep stuff around even when the concerned
ShareType or ShareGroupType objects are deleted.

So, delete type access rules when types are being deleted.

Change-Id: Id135a96f2d1b7306156bab0ddedcb1b838a74f0a
Closes-Bug: #1870751
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-08 23:50:25.000000000', 'message': 'Run ifup on a bond when a slave interface is restarted

This change adds the bond to the list of interfaces to be
restarted when a slave interface is restarted. On Fedora/CentOS
like systems restart all interface slaves in a bond, the bond
will be left in a downed state. This change runs ifup on the
bond if any slave interfaces are restarted, which insures that
the bond should be up in all cases when os-net-config exits.
Tests were added to ensure that in all cases each interface
or bond will only be restarted once, and that bonds will only
be restarted if the interface modifications require restart.

Change-Id: Ibbe8021afdc4772c6e2017d11d012b8f5c46d907
Closes-bug: 1870608
(cherry picked from commit fe13c4944be3221092f9147385700e4914a30cde)
'}]
commit_message:
Run ifup on a bond when a slave interface is restarted

This change adds the bond to the list of interfaces to be
restarted when a slave interface is restarted. On Fedora/CentOS
like systems restart all interface slaves in a bond, the bond
will be left in a downed state. This change runs ifup on the
bond if any slave interfaces are restarted, which insures that
the bond should be up in all cases when os-net-config exits.
Tests were added to ensure that in all cases each interface
or bond will only be restarted once, and that bonds will only
be restarted if the interface modifications require restart.

Change-Id: Ibbe8021afdc4772c6e2017d11d012b8f5c46d907
Closes-bug: 1870608
(cherry picked from commit fe13c4944be3221092f9147385700e4914a30cde)

[{'created': '2020-04-10 20:09:33.000000000', 'message': "Introduce scope_types in quota class Policies

oslo.policy introduced the scope_type feature which can
control the access level at system-level and project-level.
 - https://docs.openstack.org/oslo.policy/latest/user/usage.html#setting-scope
 - http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/keystone-specs/specs/keystone/queens/system-scope.html

Appropriate scope_type for nova case:
- https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/ussuri/approved/policy-defaults-refresh.html#scope

This commit introduce scope_type for qupota class API policies
as 'system'.

Also adds the test case with scope_type enabled and verify we
pass and fail the policy check with expected context.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

Change-Id: I14cd476dc27a3d7369abf5331f765b76d896592e
"}]
commit_message:
Introduce scope_types in quota class Policies

oslo.policy introduced the scope_type feature which can
control the access level at system-level and project-level.
 - https://docs.openstack.org/oslo.policy/latest/user/usage.html#setting-scope
 - http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/keystone-specs/specs/keystone/queens/system-scope.html

Appropriate scope_type for nova case:
- https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/ussuri/approved/policy-defaults-refresh.html#scope

This commit introduce scope_type for qupota class API policies
as 'system'.

Also adds the test case with scope_type enabled and verify we
pass and fail the policy check with expected context.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

Change-Id: I14cd476dc27a3d7369abf5331f765b76d896592e

projects it's worth tracking that on the results page.

subject: Close Victoria PTL election and post results
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 2799, 'name': 'Andy McCrae', 'email': 'andy.mccrae@googlemail.com', 'username': 'andrew-mccrae'}, {'_account_id': 12404, 'name': 'Rico Lin', 'email': 'ricolin@ricolky.com', 'username': 'rico.lin'}, {'_account_id': 12898, 'name': 'Tony Breeds', 'email': 'tony@bakeyournoodle.com', 'username': 'tonyb'}, {'_account_id': 14482, 'name': 'Ian Y. Choi', 'email': 'ianyrchoi@gmail.com', 'username': 'ianychoi'}, {'_account_id': 16708, 'name': 'Kendall Nelson', 'display_name': 'Kendall (diablo_rojo)', 'email': 'kennelson11@gmail.com', 'username': 'kjnelson'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 14482, 'date': '2020-04-03 06:55:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 12404, 'date': '2020-04-07 06:22:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 16708, 'date': '2020-04-08 00:11:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-2

So. I think we might have broken the close election script at some point.. the projects who didn't have candidates should still be listed in the file along with a tag saying that they need appointment by the TC. Looking into how to fix the script now."}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2020-04-08 01:08:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> So. I think we might have broken the close election script at some
 > point.. the projects who didn't have candidates should still be
 > listed in the file along with a tag saying that they need
 > appointment by the TC. Looking into how to fix the script now.

Yup we've definitely broken the tools / the tools no longer match our current process.

In the past, in the event that a project(s) had no leader(s):

 * The officials would run close-election, and the db/yaml would have a bunch
   of placeholders[1]
 * The officials would email the TC
 * The TC would "fix" the problem(s)
 * The officials would update the yaml/DB
 * The officials would use update-governance (which uses the yaml/DB)
   to update the governance repo and at the same time publish the results
   and call the election closed.

Now we seem to:

 * The officials would run close-election, publish this change and call the
   election closed
 * The officials would use update-governance (which uses the yaml/SB)
   to update the governance repo with placeholders [2]

No doubt the new process is much easier for the officials, and probably the TC.  So we have a couple of options:

 * Take this change as is
 * Take this change as is and update the generated docs to have a list of 'Leaderless projects'
 * Update the tools so that they more explicitly call out the leaderless projects.

My preference is the middle option


[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/election/src/branch/master/openstack_election/cmds/close_election.py#L49-L54

[2] https://opendev.org/openstack/election/src/branch/master/openstack_election/cmds/update_governance.py#L78-L82'}, {'account_id': 14482, 'date': '2020-04-08 01:54:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

@diablo_rojo & @tonyb: From my understanding https://review.opendev.org/#/c/717197/ patch is that actually election officials notify to TC via governance repo, and updating PTL election results to here like this is what election officials have been doing. For the election repo point of view, I think just updating election results would be sufficient. 

Through this election, TC started to find leaderless projects earlier than we notified [1] so I think this process simplifies the steps. I also agree with mentioning leaderless projects via election repo by fixing scripts but seems that current process still works. Of course, we can enhance the scripts to explicitly describe the list of leaderless projects here.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/victoria-leaderless'}, {'account_id': 14482, 'date': '2020-04-08 01:56:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Another simple proposal: adding here like this commit message would be nice?

- Needed-by: I5ba004d6af2f9edb1707a6811fe25a2accc18467'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2020-04-08 01:57:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Another simple proposal: adding here like this commit message would
 > be nice?
 > 
 > - Needed-by: I5ba004d6af2f9edb1707a6811fe25a2accc18467

I don't think that's needed"}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2020-04-08 02:04:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> @diablo_rojo & @tonyb: From my understanding https://review.opendev.org/#/c/717197/
 > patch is that actually election officials notify to TC via
 > governance repo, and updating PTL election results to here like
 > this is what election officials have been doing. For the election
 > repo point of view, I think just updating election results would be
 > sufficient.

You're correct *BUT* with my historical context this change "looked wrong" so I want to clarify the process (and what you have described matches what I described as the current process) so we're doing well there.

The follow-up would be to make the tools match the process, which they currently do not do.
 
 > Through this election, TC started to find leaderless projects
 > earlier than we notified [1] so I think this process simplifies the
 > steps. I also agree with mentioning leaderless projects via
 > election repo by fixing scripts but seems that current process
 > still works.

So I interpret that as my "Take this change as is and update the generated docs to have a list of 'Leaderless projects'" option?

 > Of course, we can enhance the scripts to explicitly
 > describe the list of leaderless projects here.
 > 
 > [1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/victoria-leaderless'}, {'account_id': 14482, 'date': '2020-04-08 02:19:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

@tonyb: Yes, and I additionally investigated - it seems that "LEADERLESS" projects were mentioned by Stein cycle [1] but did not explicitly mention from Train cycle [2][3].

> So I interpret that as my "Take this change as is and update the generated docs to have a list of 'Leaderless projects'" option?

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/589676/2/doc/source/results/stein/ptl.yaml
[2] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/644702/1/doc/source/results/train/ptl.yaml
[3] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/679884/1/doc/source/results/ussuri/ptl.yaml'}, {'account_id': 16708, 'date': '2020-04-15 00:00:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

[{'created': '2020-04-08 11:39:11.000000000', 'message': 'Remove provisioned calculation on non thin provision backends

On those backends, there is no need to calculate provisioned_capacity_gb
as it is not used during the scheduling. This calculation was not
scaling properly on big environments as it implies many database
queries.

Closes-Bug: #1869712

Change-Id: Icb8947991723a2a1cc334a72276a35cf50fc1b7d
(cherry picked from commit 2c30fed486320ec5ba88f21ae3df14b14da6eb35)
'}]
commit_message:
Remove provisioned calculation on non thin provision backends

On those backends, there is no need to calculate provisioned_capacity_gb
as it is not used during the scheduling. This calculation was not
scaling properly on big environments as it implies many database
queries.

Closes-Bug: #1869712

Change-Id: Icb8947991723a2a1cc334a72276a35cf50fc1b7d
(cherry picked from commit 2c30fed486320ec5ba88f21ae3df14b14da6eb35)

commit_message:
Introduce scope_types in flavor extra spec policy

oslo.policy introduced the scope_type feature which can
control the access level at system-level and project-level.
 - https://docs.openstack.org/oslo.policy/latest/user/usage.html#setting-scope
 - http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/keystone-specs/specs/keystone/queens/system-scope.html

Appropriate scope_type for nova case:
- https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/ussuri/approved/policy-defaults-refresh.html#scope

This commit introduce scope_type for flavor extra specs API policies
as:
- 'system' for create, update and delete flavor extra spec
- 'system' and 'project' for get flavor extra specs

Also adds the test case with scope_type enabled and verify we
pass and fail the policy check with expected context.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

Change-Id: Ie49e06382c7dd20ac47a97a2842982df877e923a

commit_message:
[NetApp] Fix vserver peer creation with same vserver

The NetApp cDOT driver is now fixed to ignore vserver peering
when creating and promoting shares replicas within the same
vserver.

Closes-Bug: #1872243
Change-Id: I0b82c15aec7862ee3630330805ac3ac177aae127
(cherry picked from commit 0d949ac485cc56a86e6a86fff7b636107cd65b9b)

commit_message:
Import os-client-config

keystoneclient-devstack-functional needs os-client-config installed,
file keystoneclient/tests/functional/base.py imports it - but it's not
in test-requirements.txt. Seems that we got it from a dependency in the
past, so make this now explicit.

Change-Id: I44217d614e2ad2238f8f00f2289b1c19f3bf436a

commit_message:
Fix distro installs

Ubuntu distro packages change /etc/swift/ owner to root, which makes
swift_rings.py fail with Permission denied.
So we shouldt run swift_rings.py as root user for distro deployments.

Change-Id: I3eeec29de43a3fb80bafef104ac87348aca4853e

commit_message:
Cleanup py27 support

This repo is now testing only with Python 3, so let's make
a few cleanups:
- Remove python 2.7 stanza from setup.py
- Remove obsolete sections from setup.cfg
- Cleanup doc/source/conf.py to remove now obsolete content.
- Move basepython to testenv, to use it everywhere in tox.ini.

Change-Id: I1f06b471e1a1ce1570862b281bdff82d27c6d381

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-13 02:12:26.000000000', 'message': 'Add test coverage of existing flavor extra spec policies

Current tests do not have good test coverage of existing policies.
Either tests for policies do not exist or if they exist then they
do not cover the actual negative and positive testing.

For Example, if any policy with default rule as admin only then
test should verify:
- policy check pass with context having admin or server owner
- policy check fail with context having non-admin and not server owner

As discussed in policy-defaults-refresh, to change the policies
with new default roles and scope_type, we need to have the enough
testing coverage of existing policy behavior.

When we will add the scope_type in policies or new default roles,
then these test coverage will be extended to adopt the new changes
and also make sure we do not break the existing behavior.

This commit covers the testing coverage of existing flavor
extra specs policies.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

Change-Id: Ic4a181fefd7903d061530aa119adc7a933703e28

commit_message:
Add test coverage of existing flavor extra spec policies

Current tests do not have good test coverage of existing policies.
Either tests for policies do not exist or if they exist then they
do not cover the actual negative and positive testing.

For Example, if any policy with default rule as admin only then
test should verify:
- policy check pass with context having admin or server owner
- policy check fail with context having non-admin and not server owner

As discussed in policy-defaults-refresh, to change the policies
with new default roles and scope_type, we need to have the enough
testing coverage of existing policy behavior.

When we will add the scope_type in policies or new default roles,
then these test coverage will be extended to adopt the new changes
and also make sure we do not break the existing behavior.

This commit covers the testing coverage of existing flavor
extra specs policies.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

Change-Id: Ic4a181fefd7903d061530aa119adc7a933703e28

commit_message:
Mark Nimble Storage Driver supported

Nimble Storage cinder driver had been marked as unsupported due to lack
of external CI running log. CI system is up
and running, updating it to be supported

Change-Id: I9c22c5f224a510e125b1dd82441eb1d63a8728f3
Signed-off-by: Raunak Kumar <rkumar@nimblestorage.com>
(cherry picked from commit 03d2762f88c701a9adf8b9c04a139d0731d43e4d)
Signed-off-by: Raunak Kumar <rkumar@nimblestorage.com>

commit_message:
Cleanup py27 support

This repo is now testing only with Python 3, so let's make
a few cleanups:
- Remove python 2.7 stanza from setup.py
- Remove obsolete sections from setup.cfg
- Update requirements, no need for python_version anymore
- Cleanup doc/source/conf.py to remove now obsolete content.
- Use newer openstackdocstheme version
- Remove install_command from tox.ini, the default is fine;
  move contraints into deps
- Move python3 into base tox environment.

Change-Id: Ibd243ce5be8415147c24f596b4059ec3fb68a89c

commit_message:
Revert "Remove ProphetStor Flexvisor Driver"

The driver removal policy was relaxed in January 2020 [0] to allow
unsupported drivers to remain in-tree at the discretion of the Cinder
project team.  Thus this driver, which was marked unsupported in
Train and removed early in Ussuri, is being restored.  It remains
deprecated and subject to removal should its presence affect the
gate adversely.

[0] https://docs.openstack.org/cinder/latest/drivers-all-about.html#driver-removal
git

This reverts commit cbda94022c2123c47661fcee525e4db5e1cab49d.

Conflicts:
  cinder/volume/drivers/prophetstor/dplcommon.py
  - revised order of imports

Change-Id: I1af2b85f97ce64e4e667a844f7e2bac94b8ac7a8
Partially-implements: bp restore-unsupported-drivers

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-04 23:58:02.000000000', 'message': "Prevent share type deletion if linked to group types

Share types can be associated with share group
types. This relationship needs to be dropped in
case share types are to be deleted, or we'll be
leaving behind dead references in the database.
Share groups cannot exist without share group
types, and hence we don't need to check on existing
groups when deleting share types; checking for
existing group types will suffice.

While deleting share group types, the projects
provided access to private share group types weren't
being cleaned up.

Change-Id: Id86a93f1923a493cefe73e2d90d5094005b42ae4
Closes-Bug: #1699836
Partial-Bug: #1870751
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Prevent share type deletion if linked to group types

Share types can be associated with share group
types. This relationship needs to be dropped in
case share types are to be deleted, or we'll be
leaving behind dead references in the database.
Share groups cannot exist without share group
types, and hence we don't need to check on existing
groups when deleting share types; checking for
existing group types will suffice.

Change-Id: Id86a93f1923a493cefe73e2d90d5094005b42ae4
Closes-Bug: #1699836
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>

commit_message:
CI: on aarch64 we only need to build images in upgrade jobs

We now publish master branch images on aarch64 (stable/train job has
some issues still).

So for normal jobs we no longer have to build them. Upgrade ones still
have to.

Change-Id: I19e6ce362a1251986c6d8e9b3d50371a655c7ac9

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-24 20:37:49.000000000', 'message': 'Use zuul cached repos for openstack services

In CI there are cached repos for the openstack services as well as
the OSA repos. We are currently using the cached repos for OSA ansible
roles, but not for the wider openstack services which are installed
from specific git repository SHA as defined by
playbooks/defaults/repo_packages/openstack_services.yml.

This patch parses the openstack_services.yml file and generates a
set of OSA override variables to use the locally cached git repos
instead of those at opendev.org. Network traffic is reduced and the
impact of OSA jobs on the opendev git servers is eased which has
caused problems when the proposal bot makes changes to all OSA repos
simultaneously.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/712459
Change-Id: I88087e3b4d6a688670e40165f127049956705801
(cherry picked from commit b3932f0e8241344ef9ece8c028ebb70bd548defc)
'}]
commit_message:
Use zuul cached repos for openstack services

In CI there are cached repos for the openstack services as well as
the OSA repos. We are currently using the cached repos for OSA ansible
roles, but not for the wider openstack services which are installed
from specific git repository SHA as defined by
playbooks/defaults/repo_packages/openstack_services.yml.

This patch parses the openstack_services.yml file and generates a
set of OSA override variables to use the locally cached git repos
instead of those at opendev.org. Network traffic is reduced and the
impact of OSA jobs on the opendev git servers is eased which has
caused problems when the proposal bot makes changes to all OSA repos
simultaneously.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/712459
Change-Id: I88087e3b4d6a688670e40165f127049956705801
(cherry picked from commit b3932f0e8241344ef9ece8c028ebb70bd548defc)

commit_message:
Remove barbican-ui deliverable for ussuri

The team has indicated that this is a new repo and not enough progress
has been made for inclusion in Ussuri. This drops the file to make sure
it is clear that this will not be part of the Ussuri coordinated
release.

Change-Id: I9b01cea63060c60313d662c6eded48af990edf82
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Update hacking for Python3

The repo is Python 3 now, so update hacking to version 3.0 which
supports Python 3.

Fix problems found.

The tempest plugin is used on older branches as well.
We really only need hacking on master anyways,
where we no longer support python 2, so here we
make the requirement specific to python 3.

Change-Id: Ia1a3c7cf9f48b30ca800c59078f38f2a22c1a0da

commit_message:
Update Grafana dashboards for stable Neutron releases

Update listed jobs to be close to master dashboard when relevant and add
some stable-specific jobs
Add master dashboard enhancements like TIMED_OUT count
Fix dashboards description formatting and content
